channel.title: Plastic chemicals 'feminise boys'
channel.description:
Chemicals in plastics alter the brains of baby boys making them "more feminine", say US researchers. http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/8361863.stm
This causes gays, no?

item.title: Plastic chemicals 'feminise boys'
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:29, topic:314449”]This was my point though - “the point of this thread was to imply that there could be a reason homosexuals feel the way they do”.

That was NOT the point of the article. Hence my “you people are making shit up”. The article didn’t even mention homosexuality.[/quote]

I never said the article was about homosexuality. No one made anything up, we just brought ideas up.

Read full topic

This was my point though - “the point of this thread was to imply that there could be a reason homosexuals feel the way they do”.

That was NOT the point of the article. Hence my “you people are making shit up”. The article didn’t even mention homosexuality.

Read full topic

item.title: Plastic chemicals 'feminise boys'
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:25, topic:314449”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=410915.msg3033484#msg3033484 date=1258565850]

It’s funny how some of you think that sexual preference has nothing to do with your gender.

According to the article, some plastics used in making toys etc. can mimic the effect of female hormones. Whether you like it or not, attraction to males is a female characteristic. If certain plastics have a ‘feminizing capacity’, why is it so strange to suggest that exposure to them may result in homosexuality?

Homosexuality ‘existed’ long before plastics were made.

Most definitely. But it was no where near as wide spread as it is today.
[/quote]

Because everyone was indoctrinated to exclude homosexuals, so hardly anyone admitted it because that would be social suicide. Look up Alan Turing. He was chemically castrated because he was homosexual, and it is believed he committed suicide because of it.[/quote]

I can’t say that’s not true.

[quote=“Mopman, post:26, topic:314449”][quote author=inertia link=topic=410915.msg3033417#msg3033417 date=1258562367]
I guess if you’ve never heard of it then it must be wrong…
[/quote]

No, I just tend to base things on experience and evidence rather than guessing…[/quote]

I’m no doctor or anything, the point of this thread was to imply that there could be a reason as to why homosexuals feel the way they do. You can’t just conclude that it isn’t caused by anything because there are many things in the world which we don’t know yet and perhaps may never know. Even if plastics have nothing to do with homosexuality, it doesn’t mean that it’s totally natural. There could be many other reasons for it, we don’t know everything.

I don’t know anything about medicine, I don’t even take biology. But your sex organs aren’t functional until you’ve reached the age of puberty, and hormones are responsible for puberty. It isn’t until you reach that age, that you’re ‘attracted’ to anyone. So if there’s an abnormality in your hormone levels at puberty, can’t it result in defects with your sexuality?

I know it doesn’t explain everything (Lesbians for example), so it’s obviously flawed. But as I said earlier, the point of this thread was to imply that there could be a reason as to why homosexuals feel the way they do.

Don’t jump to conclusions, there isn’t any hard evidence for anything just yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Plastic chemicals 'feminise boys'
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:26, topic:314449”][quote author=inertia link=topic=410915.msg3033417#msg3033417 date=1258562367]
I guess if you’ve never heard of it then it must be wrong…
[/quote]

No, I just tend to base things on experience and evidence rather than guessing…[/quote]

I don’t believe this either, but you can’t make a statement saying exposure to female hormones does not cause homosexuality just because you haven’t experienced it yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Plastic chemicals 'feminise boys'
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

MujaheD:

Whether you like it or not, attraction to males is a female characteristic. If certain plastics have a ‘feminizing capacity’, why is it so strange to suggest that exposure to them may result in homosexuality?

Because exposure to female hormones, as far as I’m aware, does not cause people to be attracted to males. I’m not an endocrinologist, I just play one on the internet, but I’ve never ever heard of that happening.

Read full topic
